org.apache.juneau.rest

Interface RestResourceResolver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RestResourceResolverSimple

    public interface RestResourceResolver
    Class used to resolve Class objects to instances.

    Used to convert classes defined via @RestResource.children() into child instances.

    Subclasses can be created to provide customized resource resolution. These can be associated with REST resources in one of the following ways:

    • @RestResource.resourceResolver() annotation.
    • RestConfig.setResourceResolver(Class)/RestConfig.setResourceResolver(RestResourceResolver) methods.

    An instance of this class can also be passed in through the servlet context as the context attribute RestResource.resourceResolver().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object resolve(Class<?> c, RestConfig config)
      Resolves the specified class to a resource object.

    • Method Detail

      • resolve

        Object resolve(Class<?> c,
               RestConfig config)
        throws Exception
        Resolves the specified class to a resource object.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own custom resolution.

        The default implementation simply creates a new class instance using Class.newInstance().

        Parameters:
        c - The class to resolve.
        config - The initialization configuration for the resource.
        Returns:
        The instance of that class.
        Throws:
        Exception - If class could not be resolved.
